results.title: New York
results.creator_credit: Paul McGuiaan, Benita Matofska and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
New York is a vast metropolis and its famous skyline makes it one of the world’s most spectacular cities. New York is also home to a multitude of ethnic groups who have created a mosaic of diverse cultures and enclaves. Ian Wright visits the famous landmarks found in every promotional brochure but also finds some interesting surprises rarely visited by tourists off the beaten track. Activities covered include: budget hotels, yellow taxis and New York clubland, kosher food on the Lower East Side, visits to the Empire State Building, Central Park and the Statue of Liberty, Harlem, the Bronx and Brooklyn, and a helicopter flight over the city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul McGuiaan, Benita Matofska and Pilot Films

results.title: Zimbabwe, Botswana & Namibia
results.creator_credit: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Join Andrew Daddo as he explores Zimbabwe, Botswana and Namibia in another ‘Lonely Planet’ travel video. Bungee jump above the Zambezi river, snack on the delicacy of boiled worms, come face to face with a pride of lions, canoe through crocodile infested waters and ride in a dunebuggy over the Namibia desert.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films

results.title: North India
results.creator_credit: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Experience Northern India with another ‘Lonely Planet’ travelling video. Climb an elephant’s trunk, learn yoga at an ashram, float along the sacred River Ganges, take a rickshaw to the Taj Mahal and spin prayer wheels in a Buddhist gompa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films

results.title: Experience Indonesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Independent traveller Mark Crowdy, avoiding the more popular tourist resorts, travels to the lesser known eastern islands of Flores, Komodo, Amban and Banda. His ultimate aim was “to find people and places who hadn’t been jaded by tourism.” The Lonely Planet travel series opens up new possibilities in travelling for the intrepid explorer, while armchair travellers can sit back in comfort and enjoy rare and beautiful locations.

results.title: Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro travels off the beaten track on a tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands. She visits hot springs heated by a volcano, views the countryside from the roof of a train and almost tries roast guinea pig. A highlight of the journey is a visit to the Amazon forest, guided by the indigenous people of the area. The Galapagos Islands were made famous by Charles Darwin in developing his theory of evolution and are home to a fascinating diversity of wildlife, with many species found nowhere else in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions

group_works.title: Duke of Wellington
group_works.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions

results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions

results.title: Living with Technology
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Sound in View (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Technology”.
A visual depiction of sound waves including digital and modulated formats. The aim of this program is to teach the meanings of a number of terms used to describe the signals used in telecommunications.

results.title: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters
results.brief_description: ‘Living with disaster’ is a major project by ACMI in collaboration with the Attorney General’s Department through its Emergency Management division and the CFA, in order to capture stories of young people who have survived natural disasters.
results.title_for_label: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters
